Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2014 02:54PM mrs_s314 wrote: I can tell you from personal experience, it's most likely a fibroadenoma.  I consider myself an expert because I've had three.  I'm 27, and had my first one when I was 21.  It was a hard lump that I could move around.  Also, don't be alarmed that it popped up in 3 weeks.  Fibroadenomas can be tied in with your period, (as can cysts) so they can get bigger or smaller depending where you are in your cycle.  That being said, if it is a fibroadenoma, make sure the doctor biopsies it AND be aware that a complete removal of the fibroadenoma is not your only option.  Cryoablation is a new treatment for tumors of the breast, and it involves local anesthesia vs. general anesthesia and it's a 30 minute procedure which the tumor is frozen and reabsorbed into your body, and is a great option for people who might have multiple fibroadenomas.  The best advice is meet with a surgeon that specializes in diseases of the breast.  They're the ones who are going to have the most experience with these types of issues.  You're going to be okay!
Posts.Title: Finally having ultrasound tomorrow, super scared :( Dannii23 mrs_s314
